investigation.title: Mlh1 deficiency increases the risk of hematopoietic malignancy after simulated space radiation exposure
investigation.description: Cancer-causing genome instability is a major concern during space travel due to exposure of astronauts to potent sources of high-linear energy transfer (LET) ionizing radiation. Hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are particularly susceptible to genotoxic stress, and accumulation of damage can lead to HSC dysfunction and oncogenesis.

project.identifier: Heavy_Ion_HZE_Irradiation, High_LET_Irradiation, Low_Dose_Irradiation, High_Dose_Irradiation, Gamma_Irradiation, Low_LET_Irradiation, Multiple_Radiation_Types
project.title: Contribution of GCR Exposure to Hematopoietic Stem Cell Dysfunction and Oncogenesis
project.funding: This research was funded by NASA

publications.title: Mlh1 deficiency increases the risk of hematopoietic malignancy after simulated space radiation exposure
publications.summary: Mlh1 deficiency increases the risk of hematopoietic malignancy after simulated space radiation exposure â€” 10.1038/s41375-018-0269-8
